title: Elton John claims The Queen 'playfully slapped her nephew for ignoring instructions'
text:

Music legend Elton John claims he once saw the Queen repeatedly slap her nephew Viscount Linley during a party.

The singer alleges he saw the monarch playfully admonish Princess Margaret’s son, telling him “Don’t argue with me, I am the Queen!" when he tried to fob her off.

Writing in his new autobiography ‘Me’, Sir Elton makes a number of eye-opening revelations about life in the company of the Royals, adding: “I know the Queen’s public image isn’t exactly one of wild frivolity, but… in private, she could be hilarious.”

Describing that particular incident, he reminisces: “I saw her approach Viscount Linley and ask him to look in on his sister, who’d been taken ill and had retired to her room.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

“When he repeatedly tried to fob her off, the Queen lightly slapped him across the face, saying, ‘Don’t’ – SLAP – ‘argue’ – SLAP – ‘with’ – SLAP – ‘me’ – SLAP – ‘I’ – SLAP – ‘am’ – SLAP – ‘THE QUEEN!’”

The singer adds that it appeared to have done the trick as he scuttled off to do as he was told.

He goes on: “As he left, she saw me staring at her, gave me a wink and walked off.”

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Viscount Linley, also the 2nd Earl of Snowdon, is the son of the Queen’s only sister and her husband Antony Armstrong-Jones.

In his book, Sir Elton also makes the gobsmacking revelation of witnessing Richard Were and Sylvester Stallone fight over Princess Diana at a dinner party.

Writing about the princess shortly after her divorce, he revealed: “The most peculiar scene developed.

“Straight away, Richard Gere and Diana seemed very taken with each other.”

However, he goes on to claim that this blossoming friendship did not go down well with Sylvester Stallone, with the pair later squaring up to each other in a corridor “apparently about to settle their differences over Diana by having a fist-fight”.

Sir Elton John’s official autobiography is due to release on October 15.
